alert.note: Alert for City of Martinsville; Henry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 6:49PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Virginia, including the following county and independent city, City of Martinsville and Henry. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 649 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Marrowbone Creek, Little Marrowbone Creek, Leatherwood Creek, Hairston Branch, Mulberry Creek, Mill Creek, Matrimony Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Martinsville... Ridgeway... Chatmoss... Laurel Park... Villa Heights... Collinsville... Leatherwood... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
